item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 29, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Where Do the Bytes Go? (9 points | discuss)
2. Show HN: Physical Pomodoro Timer with ESP32 and e-paper screen (23 points | 6 comments)
3. PCIe Endpoint on Xilinx 7-Series FPGAs with PCIe_2_1 Hard Block and GTP (20 points | discuss)
4. Mathematical Compact Models of Advanced Transistors [pdf] (35 points | 2 comments)
5. Plain – a web framework for building products with Python (142 points | 96 comments)
6. You Need Subtyping (30 points | 24 comments)
7. Chimpanzees act as 'engineers', choosing materials to make tools (9 points | 2 comments)
8. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (529 points | 112 comments)
9. Playstation Mod Turns the PSOne into a Crustacean (53 points | 14 comments)
10. Conquest of the Incas (66 points | 44 comments)
11. How to write blog posts that developers read (472 points | 137 comments)
12. Xee: A Modern XPath and XSLT Engine in Rust (353 points | 191 comments)
13. Noise cancellation improves turn-taking for AI Voice Agents (93 points | 36 comments)
14. Show HN Pianoboi – displays sheet music as you play your piano (48 points | 5 comments)
15. Low responsiveness of ML models to critical or deteriorating health conditions (15 points | discuss)
16. Emulating the YM2612: Part 1 – Interface (25 points | 1 comment)
17. OpenAI Close to Finalizing Its $40B SoftBank-Led Funding (4 points | 1 comment)
18. Self-Supervised Learning from Images with JEPA (2023) (31 points | 7 comments)
19. Testing Without Mocks: A Pattern Language (2023) (69 points | 25 comments)
20. Digital Echoes and Unquiet Minds (131 points | 69 comments)
21. xAI has acquired X, xAI now valued at $80B (625 points | 831 comments)
22. Optimizing Matrix Multiplication on RDNA3 (89 points | 13 comments)
23. Window cleaner in quest to confirm priceless Shakespeare portrait (14 points | 7 comments)
24. I asked police to send me their public surveillance footage of my car (594 points | 469 comments)
25. Postgres Language Server: Initial Release (111 points | 17 comments)
26. Decomposing a Factorial into Large Factors (116 points | 24 comments)
27. Show HN: Hexi – Modern header-only network binary serialisation for C++ (91 points | 35 comments)
28. The Biology of B-Movie Monsters (2003) (85 points | 43 comments)
29. MilliForth-6502: The smallest Forth real programming language for 6502 (116 points | 32 comments)
30. Finley (YC W21) Is Hiring a Technical Implementations Specialist ( | hide)
